body: I am writing to apply for the Factory Director position at Rockwool. With more than 20 years of experience directing large-scale industrial facilities and aviation programs, I have consistently delivered production, cost, quality, and delivery targets while building safe, engaged, and high-performing teams.

As Sr. Operations & Data Analytics Manager at Allmine Paving, I lead 24/7 multi-site operations with $40M+ annual revenue. I increased plant throughput by 12%, reduced overtime costs by 22%, and achieved over 600 days without a lost-time injury while sustaining zero OSHA PSM findings. By implementing SCADA-driven analytics and digital twin technology, I cut downtime by 35% and built predictive maintenance capabilities that drove efficiency and reliability.

My leadership style emphasizes safety, compliance, and continuous improvement. I hold Lean Six Sigma Green Belt certifications and have embedded TPM culture to enhance workforce readiness and efficiency. I have negotiated supplier and freight contracts yielding $2.3M in savings while improving DIFOT by 15%, demonstrating my ability to align operational excellence with financial stewardship.

Earlier in my career, as a Senior Program Manager in the U.S. Army, I directed training and development for 400+ aviators, achieving a 97% qualification pass rate while maintaining zero major incidents. This experience taught me to manage complex operations under pressure, build scalable systems, and cultivate accountability across diverse teams.

Rockwool’s mission to deliver sustainable building solutions while investing in community aligns closely with my values. I am eager to bring my background in operations leadership, digital transformation, and continuous improvement to ensure Rockwool’s Ranson facility delivers excellence in safety, quality, and performance.
